data.scheme_name: Chief Minister’s Rojgar Yojana (CMRY – 2023) Scheme - All Genders - Other Backward Caste - Existing
data.benefits: Scheme provide loan assistance up to Rs. 23.75 Lakhs to support self-employment among Goan youth.
data.eligibility:
1. Individual age should be more than 18 years & less than 55 years. 
  2. The loan repayment period should not exceed 60 years of the age of the Individual. 
  3. Must be Class- VIII pass. 
  4. Must be permanent resident of the area for at least 15 years are eligible under this scheme.
data.conditions:
1. No defaulters to any financial institutions. 
  2. Must not have been assisted under other subsidy-linked schemes unless specified
data.beneficiaries:
1. Age: Between 18 and 50 years. Relaxable by 5 years for widows, disabled persons, SC/ST, and OBC. 
  2. The loan repayment period should not exceed 60 years of the age of the Individual. 
  3. Residence: Must have lived in Goa for at least 15 years. Those married to a person of Goan origin and settled in Goa for at least one year are also eligible. 
  4. Educational Qualifications: Preference for those with technical/professional qualifications. Minimum educational requirement is passing Class 8, with exemptions in deserving cases.
data.prerequisites: Should not be a defaulter to any nationalized bank/financial institution/co-operative bank. A person already assisted under other subsidy linked scheme will not be eligible under this scheme, unless otherwise relaxed/specified.
data.context: The State Government of Goa has started the Chief Minister’s Rojgar Yojana (CMRY). Collaboration with the Economic Development Corporation of Goa for unemployed youth. Under this scheme, with the help of government loans, other backward class people, scheduled castes, scheduled tribes and all ordinary people have to provide employment.
data.objective: To provide self-employment (Rojgar) opportunities to Goan youth by way of financial assistance to new as well as expansion of existing units for setting up projects for eligible activities.
data.description:
Loan Assistance on Project cost:

Eligible project cost: Up to Rs.25 lakhs for professionals and Rs.20 lakhs for others.
(DITC share capital : 50% of project cost and EDC Term loan : 45% of project cost)
Promoter’s Contribution: 5% of project cost
Interest Rate: Both EDC Term loan & DITC Share capital @ 8%p.a
Moratorium Period: Up to 1 year

Note: Interest rebate 75%(@ 6% p.a.) of EDC Term loan and DITC share capital shall be credited to the loan account of the beneficiary as subsidy, subject to terms and conditions.
data.how_to_apply: Applicant can apply by going to nearest EDC office. Also can apply online through https://goaonline.gov.in/Public/UserRegistration_af
data.funding_mechanism:
1. Disbursement of loan is made to the suppliers on the basis of proforma invoice in respect of machinery, furniture and furnishing, working capital, vehicle etc. 
  2. The supplier will have to furnish an undertaking in the prescribed format stating that the items/vehicle will be delivered as per specified in proforma invoice. 
  3. Physical verification of the assets acquired and valuation of the furniture/furnishing will be carried out. 
  4. This subsidy shall be released to borrowers who pay EMIs regularly & the unit being fully operational.
data.additional_info:
1. Technical/professional qualifications include candidates trained by GHRSSIDC, Agriculture Department, Forest Department or under any other Government Training Scheme. 
  2. Projects without fixed assets are not eligible, working capital will be restricted to 40% of the project cost and CMRY Loan will be restricted to one loan (existing/new) per family. 
  3. Penal interest @ 2% p.a. on the defaulted amount for the defaulted period of EDC Term loan & DITC share capital shall be charged. Security being First charge of mortgage/hypothecation of fixed/current assets. 
  4. Loans up to Rs. 2 lakh: Personal guarantee from the applicant and spouse (if married) or parent/relative (if unmarried). Non-transport loans require hypothecation/mortgage of fixed assets covering at least 75% of the loan (50% for SC/ST applicants). 
  5. Loans above Rs. 2 lakh up to Rs. 6 lakh: Personal guarantee from spouse (if married) or parent/relative (if unmarried), plus a third-party guarantor, who can be a government employee, someone with a taxable income of at least Rs. 5 lakh over the past 3 years, an employee of a reputable company with over 10 years of service, or someone owning unencumbered property in Goa. 
  6. Loans above Rs. 6 lakh: Notarised copy of ownership documents of unencumbered immovable property owned by the guarantor, commensurate with the loan amount. 
  7. The guarantor must not have defaulted on any loans and should be financially capable of supporting the loan. 
  8. The Scheme envisages compulsory entrepreneurship training of upto 3 days for the beneficiary after the loan is sanctioned but before disbursement of the loan. This may be exempted and made optional based on recommendations of Task Force Committee on case to case basis.
data.checklist_info_a:
Birth certificate
15 years Residential certificate
Aadhar card
PAN card
Election card
Copy of bank passbook
Self declaration by the applicant in the prescribed format.
Project report
Caste Certificate
What are the documents of the guarantor required?
Copy of latest house tax if loan is less then Rs 6 lakhs
Notarized copy of title of immoveable property owned if loan is more then Rs 6 lakhs
data.checklist_info_c: Applicant can apply by going to nearest EDC office.
data.checklist_info_d: Applicant can apply by going to nearest EDC office.
